page.title: 10Spennells Estate.
page.content: A school survey showed that families moving onto the new Spennells estate, South of Kidderminster, were attracted by cheap, "up-market" houses, and the availability of self build schemes. 38% of families moved from other parts of Kidderminster, and 46% came from the West Midlands and Birmingham. 53% of the men commute back to this area daily, and only 28% work locally. The male unemployment rate is 9%, mainly on the council estate. 67% of households have children under 18, and few of these have relatives within a 10 mile radius. The birth-rate is high, and only 4% of houses have people over 60. 28% of women are employed, mainly in local part-time work. Of the 203 children at the First School, 9% belong to single-parent families or have step-parents.
